lines.content: # I would like to join this taskList. How can I help the project
For more information, please refer to our [contributor's guide](https://oss-generic.github.io/process/).
This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/christopher.ui.Christopher.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run christopher.ui.Christopher.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

You can add a deadline to his taskList with the format "deadline (task) /by (date of deadline)"

* Handles the procedures when user's input has been confirmed to be a bye instruction
* Saves the current taskList to tasks.txt data file
* Handles commands after interpreting user inputs
* This class handles the things to be done when the user decides to add a deadline task to the list
* Carries out and add this deadline task to the taskList passed
assert (this.task instanceof Deadline) : "Assumed to be a deadline task";
* Returns the confirmation and the state of taskList
* @return the string to be said to the user
return String.format("Got it. I've added this task:\n%s\nNow you have %d tasks", this.task,
* Handles the procedures to be done when user command is confirmed to be a delete command
public DeleteCommand(int index, TaskList taskList, Task task) {
* Notifies user of the current state of taskList
return String.format("Noted, I've removed this task:\n%s\nNow you have %d in tasks in the list",
* Handles the prodecures when the user wants to insert an event object into the taskList
* Adds this event task into the taskList to be passed in my Christopher during construction
assert (this.task instanceof Event) : "Assumed to be an event task";
* Gives the String to be printed for the user to see
* @return the string to be said to the user
return String.format("Got it, I've add this task:\n%s\nNow you have %d tasks", this.task,
* Executes the find command when the user is confirmed to be choosing such command
* Finds the matching tasks given a set of keywords
* Informs the user which tasks match the ones they want to find
* @return the TaskList.toString() of the tasks they are interested in
return String.format("Here are matching tasks in your list:\n$s", this.result);
* Handles the procedures when user's input has been confirmed to be a List instruction
* Does nothing since list instruction has nothing to be done
* Returns the current state of TaskList in a string form
* Handles procedures when the user inserted mark command
* Returns the string to be said to the user
return String.format("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n%s", this.taskList.getTask(this.index));
* Handles procedures when user wants to sort tasks by "deadline"
* the new taskList that is held by this object is sorted according to deadline
* @return taskList.string() for the newly sorted list
return String.format("Alright, here are tasks sorted by Deadline\n%s", this.taskList);
* Handles procedures when the user decides to add todo into the taskList
* Carries out toDo command which is to add this into the taskList
assert (this.task instanceof ToDo) : "Assumed to be a todo task";
* Returns the confirmation and the state of the taskList
* @return the string to be said by christopher to the user
return String.format("Got it, I've add this task:\n%s\nNow you have %d tasks", this.task,
* Handles when the user wants an unmarkCommand
* Unmark the specified task at the index position
* Returns verifying the unmarking of the specified task
* @return String to be shown to user
return String.format("Ok, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n%s", this.taskList.getTask(index));

* Parses user input and returns a DeadlineCommand

public DeadlineCommand parseDeadline(String input) throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException, WrongInstructionException {
return new DeadlineCommand(new Deadline(deadlineName, deadlineInput[1]), this.taskList);
* Parses user input and returns an EventCommand

public EventCommand parseEvent(String input) throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException, WrongInstructionException {
return new EventCommand(new Event(eventName, eventInput[1], eventInput[2]), this.taskList);

* @throws IOException thrown when the target file has various issues

* This method takes in the body of the task written in tasks.txt and see if they are done

* @return true if done and false if not done

public Task parseTask(String line) throws WrongInstructionException {

* This is a form of task, specifically a task with a deadline attached

* This is task class; it will have children of specific task types
* It has a name, and an indication of whether it is done
* @throws WrongInstructionException wrongly formatted or incomplete info

* Marks the specific task instance to be incomplete
* @return the isDone status of said task
* Returns the deadline as an optional as some types of tasks may not have a deadline

* Returns the task at the specified position
* @param index index is one less than position (e.g task3 has index 2)

* Removes the specified task from the list

* @param keywords the specified keywords to look out for
* @return TaskList containing the list of desired tasks

* Returns the empty option because this task has no deadline

* This class is for generating the standard greetings and goodbyes the bot may say to the user
* Bot uses this once at the start
System.out.println(" What can I do for you?");
* Bot users this once at the end when user input 'bye'
* Uses to say goodbye to the user
System.out.println(" Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Regurgitates the command types by the user
* @param s this is a command by the user
* This is an enum for all the possible commands chatbot christopher.ui.Christopher could take
TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT, LIST, BYE, MARK, UNMARK, DELETE, FIND, SORT, UNKNOWN;
* Takes a command given by the user and match it to one of the enum types
* @return one of the enum listed above
* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* A GUI for Christopher using FXML.
* Creates two dialog boxes, one echoing user input and the other containing Duke's reply and then appends them to
* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.
